017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ap;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.MAINTAINED;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ap.CollectionKind.NO_COLLECTION;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.capitalize;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
024
025import javax.lang.model.element.Name;
026import java.util.List;
027import java.util.Optional;
028import java.util.OptionalInt;
029
030import org.apiguardian.api.API;
031import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.config.SpecialPropertyType;
033import org.tquadrat.foundation.config.ap.impl.CodeBuilder;
034import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.CodeBlock;
035import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.FieldSpec;
036import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.MethodSpec;
037import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.TypeName;
038
039/**
040 *  The specification for a property of a configuration bean.
041 *
042 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
043 *  @version $Id: PropertySpec.java 1006 2022-02-03 23:03:04Z tquadrat $
044 *  @since 0.1.0
045 *
046 *  @UMLGraph.link
047 */
048@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyMethods" )
049@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: PropertySpec.java 1006 2022-02-03 23:03:04Z tquadrat $" )
050@API( status = MAINTAINED, since = "0.1.0" )
051public interface PropertySpec
052{
053        /*---------------*\
054    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
055        \*---------------*/
056    /**
057     *  The flags for a property.
058     *
059     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
060     *  @version $Id: PropertySpec.java 1006 2022-02-03 23:03:04Z tquadrat $
061     *  @since 0.1.0
062     *
063     *  @UMLGraph.link
064     */
065    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: PropertySpec.java 1006 2022-02-03 23:03:04Z tquadrat $" )
066    @API( status = MAINTAINED, since = "0.1.0" )
067    public static enum PropertyFlag
068    {
069            /*------------------*\
070        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
071            \*------------------*/
072        /**
073         * Indicates that this property can be initialised from and persisted
074         * to an
075         * {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.inifile.INIFile}.
076         * This also means that the methods
077         * {@link #getINIGroup()}
078         * and
079         * {@link #getINIKey()}
080         * may not return
081         * {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}.
082         */
083        ALLOWS_INIFILE,
084
085        /**
086         * Indicates that this property can be initialised from and persisted
087         * to a preference. This also means that the methods
088         * {@link #getPrefsAccessorClass()}
089         * and
090         * {@link #getPrefsKey()}
091         * may not return
092         * {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}.
093         */
094        ALLOWS_PREFERENCES,
095
096        /**
097         * Indicates that this property is initialised from the value of an
098         * environment variable. The method
099         * {@link #getEnvironmentVariableName()}
100         * may not return
101         * {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}.
102         *
103         * @see System#getenv()
104         */
105        ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE,
106
107        /**
108         *  <p>{@summary Indicates that this property will not be part of the
109         *  map, in case the configuration bean implements
110         *  {@link java.util.Map}.}</p>
111         *  <p>There is no related annotation for this flag, it is used mainly
112         *  for
113         *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.config.SpecialProperty special properties}.</p>
114         */
115        EXEMPT_FROM_MAP,
116
117        /**
118         *  Indicates that this property will not appear in the return value of
119         *  {@link #toString()}.
120         */
121        EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING,
122
123        /**
124         *  <p>{@summary Indicates that the getter method for this property is
125         *  default.} This means that the method will not be implemented, and
126         *  that there is no field for the property.</p>
127         *  <p>This flag implies
128         *  {@link #EXEMPT_FROM_MAP}.</p>
129         */
130        GETTER_IS_DEFAULT,
131
132        /**
133         *  <p>{@summary Indicates that the implementation of
134         *  {@link java.util.Map}
135         *  will refer to the getter for this property, instead of the
136         *  field.}</p>
137         *  <p>There is no related annotation for this flag, it is used mainly
138         *  for
139         *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.config.SpecialProperty special properties}.</p>
140         */
141        GETTER_ON_MAP,
142
143        /**
144         * Indicates that the getter method returns an instance of
145         * {@link Optional}
146         * holding the configuration value.
147         */
148        GETTER_RETURNS_OPTIONAL,
149
150        /**
151         *  Indicates that a value for this property is required on the
152         *  command line.
153         */
154        PROPERTY_CLI_MANDATORY,
155
156        /**
157         *  Indicates that it is possible to provide multiple values for this
158         *  property on the command line.
159         */
160        PROPERTY_CLI_MULTIVALUED,
161
162        /**
163         *  Indicates that the property can be initialised with a command line
164         *  argument.
165         *
166         *  @see    #getCLIArgumentIndex()
167         *  @see    #getCLIValueHandlerClass()
168         *  @see    #getCLIFormat()
169         *  @see    #getCLIMetaVar()
170         */
171        PROPERTY_IS_ARGUMENT,
172
173        /**
174         *  Indicates that the property value can be modified. Basically, it
175         *  means that there is a setter and/or an 'add' method for that
176         *  property.
177         */
178        PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE,
179
180        /**
181         *  Indicates that the property can be initialised with a command line
182         *  option.
183         *
184         *  @see    #getCLIOptionNames()
185         *  @see    #getCLIValueHandlerClass()
186         *  @see    #getCLIFormat()
187         *  @see    #getCLIMetaVar()
188         */
189        PROPERTY_IS_OPTION,
190
191        /**
192         * Indicates that the property is a 'special' property. This also
193         * means that
194         * {@link PropertySpec#getSpecialPropertyType()}
195         * will not return an
196         * {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}
197         * value.
198         */
199        PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL,
200
201        /**
202         *  Indicates that the access to the property requires synchronisation.
203         */
204        PROPERTY_REQUIRES_SYNCHRONIZATION,
205
206        /**
207         * Indicates that the setter method for this property should check for
208         * an empty argument.
209         */
210        SETTER_CHECK_EMPTY,
211
212        /**
213         * Indicates that the setter method for this property should check for
214         * a null argument.
215         */
216        SETTER_CHECK_NULL,
217
218        /**
219         * Indicates that the setter method for this property is default; this
220         * means that the method will not be implemented, and that there is no
221         * field for the property.
222         */
223        SETTER_IS_DEFAULT,
224
225        /**
226         * Indicates that this property is initialised from the value of a
227         * system preference. The methods
228         * {@link #getSystemPrefsPath()},
229         * {@link #getPrefsKey()}
230         * and
231         * {@link #getPrefsAccessorClass()}
232         * may not return
233         * {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}.
234         */
235        SYSTEM_PREFERENCE,
236
237        /**
238         * Indicates that this property is initialised from the value of a
239         * system property. The method
240         * {@link #getSystemPropertyName()}
241         * may not return
242         * {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}.
243         *
244         * @see System#getProperties()
245         */
246        SYSTEM_PROPERTY
247    }
248    //  enum PropertyFlag
249
250        /*-----------*\
251    ====** Constants **========================================================
252        \*-----------*/
253
254        /*---------*\
255    ====** Methods **==========================================================
256        \*---------*/
257    /**
258     *  Creates the specification of the 'add' method for this property.
259     *
260     *  @param  codeBuilder The factory for the code generation.
261     *  @return An instance of
262     *      {@link Optional}
263     *      that holds the method specification.
264     */
265    public Optional<MethodSpec> createAddMethod( final CodeBuilder codeBuilder );
266
267    /**
268     *  Creates a code block that is a fragment for the constructor of the new
269     *  configuration bean and that initialises this property.
270     *
271     *  @param  codeBuilder The factory for the code generation.
272     *  @return An instance of
273     *      {@link Optional}
274     *      that holds the code block.
275     */
276    public Optional<CodeBlock> createConstructorFragment( final CodeBuilder codeBuilder );
277
278    /**
279     *  Creates the field specification for this property.
280     *
281     *  @param  codeBuilder The factory for the code generation.
282     *  @return An instance of
283     *      {@link Optional}
284     *      that holds the field specification.
285     */
286    public Optional<FieldSpec> createField( final CodeBuilder codeBuilder );
287
288    /**
289     *  Creates the specification of the getter for this property.
290     *
291     *  @param  codeBuilder The factory for the code generation.
292     *  @return An instance of
293     *      {@link Optional}
294     *      that holds the method specification.
295     */
296    public Optional<MethodSpec> createGetter( final CodeBuilder codeBuilder );
297
298    /**
299     *  Creates the specification of the setter for this property.
300     *
301     *  @param  codeBuilder The factory for the code generation.
302     *  @return An instance of
303     *      {@link Optional}
304     *      that holds the method specification.
305     */
306    public Optional<MethodSpec> createSetter( final CodeBuilder codeBuilder );
307
308    /**
309     *  Returns the name of the 'add' method's argument.
310     *
311     *  @return The argument name; is probable {@code null} when
312     *      {@link #getAddMethodName()}
313     *      returns
314     *      {@link Optional#empty()}.
315     */
316    public Name getAddMethodArgumentName();
317
318    /**
319     *  Returns the name of the 'add' method for this property.
320     *
321     *  @return An instance of
322     *      {@link Optional}
323     *      that holds the name of the add method.
324     */
325    public Optional<Name> getAddMethodName();
326
327    /**
328     *  <p>{@summary Returns the index for an argument on the command
329     *  line.}</p>
330     *  <p>The return value will be
331     *  {@linkplain OptionalInt#empty() empty}
332     *  if the property is not a CLI argument.</p>
333     *
334     *  @return An instance of
335     *      {@link OptionalInt}
336     *      that holds the index.
337     *
338     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Argument#index()
339     */
340    public OptionalInt getCLIArgumentIndex();
341
342    /**
343     *  Returns the special CLI format.
344     *
345     *  @return An instance of
346     *      {@link Optional}
347     *      that holds the format.
348     *
349     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Argument#format()
350     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Option#format()
351     */
352    public Optional<String> getCLIFormat();
353
354    /**
355     *  Returns the name of the CLI meta variable for this property.
356     *
357     *  @return An instance of
358     *      {@link Optional}
359     *      that holds the name of the meta variable.
360     *
361     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Argument#metaVar()
362     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Option#metaVar()
363     */
364    public Optional<String> getCLIMetaVar();
365
366    /**
367     *  <p>{@summary Returns the CLI option names.} The mandatory first name in
368     *  the list is the primary name, the optional others are the aliases.</p>
369     *  <p>The return value will be
370     *  {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}
371     *  if the property is not a CLI option.</p>
372     *
373     *  @return An instance of
374     *      {@link Optional}
375     *      that holds the option names.
376     *
377     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Option#name()
378     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Option#aliases()
379     */
380    @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalContainsCollection" )
381    public Optional<List<String>> getCLIOptionNames();
382
383    /**
384     *  Returns the CLI usage text for this property. This text will not be
385     *  localised.
386     *
387     *  @return An instance of
388     *      {@link Optional}
389     *      that holds the usage text.
390     *
391     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Argument#usage()
392     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Option#usage()
393     */
394    public Optional<String> getCLIUsage();
395
396    /**
397     *  Returns the CLI usage key for this property. This key is used to
398     *  retrieve a localised usage text.
399     *
400     *  @return An instance of
401     *      {@link Optional}
402     *      that holds the usage key.
403     *
404     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Argument#usageKey()
405     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Option#usageKey()
406     */
407    public Optional<String> getCLIUsageKey();
408
409    /**
410     *  Returns the CLI value handler class for this property.
411     *
412     *  @return An instance of
413     *      {@link Optional}
414     *      that holds the
415     *      {@link TypeName}
416     *      for the handler class.
417     *
418     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Argument#handler()
419     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Option#handler()
420     */
421    public Optional<TypeName> getCLIValueHandlerClass();
422
423    /**
424     *  Returns the kind of collection for this property.
425     *
426     *  @return The collection kind.
427     */
428    public CollectionKind getCollectionKind();
429
430    /**
431     *  Returns the name of the environment variable that is used to initialise
432     *  this property.
433     *
434     *  @return An instance of
435     *      {@link Optional}
436     *      that holds the environment variable name.
437     *
438     * @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.EnvironmentVariable
439     */
440    public Optional<String> getEnvironmentVariableName();
441
442    /**
443     *  Returns the name of the field for the property.
444     *
445     *  @return The field name.
446     */
447    public default String getFieldName() { return format( "m_%s", capitalize( getPropertyName() ) ); }
448
449    /**
450     *  Returns a builder for the getter for this property.
451     *
452     *  @return An instance of
453     *      {@link Optional}
454     *      that holds the builder.
455     */
456    public Optional<MethodSpec.Builder> getGetterBuilder();
457
458    /**
459     *  Returns the name of the getter method name. If there is no name for the
460     *  method, it will not be generated.
461     *
462     *  @return An instance of
463     *      {@link Optional}
464     *      that holds the name of the getter method.
465     */
466    public Optional<Name> getGetterMethodName();
467
468    /**
469     *  Returns the return type of the getter. This is not necessarily the same
470     *  as the
471     *  {@linkplain #getPropertyType() property type}.
472     *
473     *  @return The getter's return type.
474     */
475    public TypeName getGetterReturnType();
476
477    /**
478     *  Returns the comment for this property in the {@code INI} file.
479     *
480     *  @return An instance of
481     *      {@link Optional}
482     *      that holds the comment.
483     */
484    public Optional<String> getINIComment();
485
486    /**
487     *  Returns the group for this property in the {@code INI} file.
488     *
489     *  @return An instance of
490     *      {@link Optional}
491     *      that holds the group name.
492     */
493    public Optional<String> getINIGroup();
494
495    /**
496     *  Returns the key for this property in the {@code INI} file.
497     *
498     *  @return An instance of
499     *      {@link Optional}
500     *      that holds the key.
501     */
502    public Optional<String> getINIKey();
503
504    /**
505     *  <p>{@summary Returns the {@code Preferences} accessor class.}</p>
506     *  <p>This is used when this property is linked to a preference, but also
507     *  to initialise it from a SYSTEM preference.</p>
508     *
509     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.PreferencesBeanSpec
510     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Preference#accessor()
511     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.SystemPreference#accessor()
512     *
513     *  @return An instance of
514     *      {@link Optional}
515     *      that holds the
516     *      {@link TypeName}
517     *      for the accessor class.
518     */
519    public Optional<TypeName> getPrefsAccessorClass();
520
521    /**
522     *  <p>{@summary Returns the {@code Preferences} key for this
523     *  property.}</p>
524     *  <p>This is used when this property is linked to a preference, but also
525     *  to initialise it from a SYSTEM preference. In first case, the name is
526     *  defaulted to the property name, while it is mandatory otherwise.</p>
527     *
528     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.PreferencesBeanSpec
529     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.Preference#key()
530     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.SystemPreference#key()
531     *
532     *  @return An instance of
533     *      {@link Optional}
534     *      that holds the preferences key for this property.
535     */
536    public Optional<String> getPrefsKey();
537
538    /**
539     *  Returns the name of the configuration property.
540     *
541     *  @return The name.
542     */
543    public String getPropertyName();
544
545    /**
546     *  Returns the property type.
547     *
548     *  @return The property type.
549     */
550    public TypeName getPropertyType();
551
552    /**
553     *  Returns the name of the setter's argument.
554     *
555     *  @return The argument name; is probably {@code null} when
556     *      {@link #getSetterMethodName()}
557     *      returns
558     *      {@link Optional#empty()}.
559     */
560    public Name getSetterArgumentName();
561
562    /**
563     *  Returns a builder for the setter for this property.
564     *
565     *  @return An instance of
566     *      {@link Optional}
567     *      that holds the builder.
568     */
569    public Optional<MethodSpec.Builder> getSetterBuilder();
570
571    /**
572     *  Returns the name of the setter method name. If there is no name for the
573     *  method, it will not be generated.
574     *
575     *  @return An instance of
576     *      {@link Optional}
577     *      that holds the name of the setter method.
578     */
579    public Optional<Name> getSetterMethodName();
580
581    /**
582     *  Return the 'speciality' type for this property.
583     *
584     *  @return An instance of
585     *      {@link Optional}
586     *      that holds the speciality type.
587     */
588    public Optional<SpecialPropertyType> getSpecialPropertyType();
589
590    /**
591     *  Returns the class that implements the String converter for the type of
592     *  this property.
593     *
594     *  @return An instance of
595     *      {@link Optional}
596     *      that holds the implementation class for
597     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.StringConverter}.
598     */
599    public Optional<TypeName> getStringConverterClass();
600
601    /**
602     *  Returns the path to the SYSTEM {@code Preferences} node that holds the
603     *  data for the initialisation of this property.
604     *
605     *  @return An instance of
606     *      {@link Optional}
607     *      that holds the path.
608     *
609     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.SystemPreference#path()
610     */
611    public Optional<String> getSystemPrefsPath();
612
613    /**
614     *  Returns the name of the system property that is used to initialise this
615     *  property.
616     *
617     *  @return An instance of
618     *      {@link Optional}
619     *      that holds the system property name.
620     *
621     * @see org.tquadrat.foundation.config.SystemProperty
622     */
623    public Optional<String> getSystemPropertyName();
624
625    /**
626     *  Checks whether the given flag is set for this property.
627     *
628     *  @param  flag    The flag to test for.
629     *  @return {@code true} if the flag is set, {@code false} otherwise.
630     */
631    public boolean hasFlag( final PropertyFlag flag );
632
633    /**
634     *  Checks whether this property is a collection of some kind.
635     *
636     *  @return {@code true} if this property is a collection, {@code false}
637     *      otherwise.
638     */
639    public default boolean isCollection() { return getCollectionKind() != NO_COLLECTION; }
640
641    /**
642     *  Returns the flag that indicates whether the property is an
643     *  {@link Enum enum}
644     *  type.
645     *
646     *  @return {@code true} if the property type is an {@code enum},
647     *      {@code false} otherwise.
648     */
649    public boolean isEnum();
650
651    /**
652     *  {@summary Checks whether this property is exposed to the CLI.} This
653     *  means that it has either the flag
654     *  {@link PropertyFlag#PROPERTY_IS_ARGUMENT}
655     *  or the
656     *  {@link PropertyFlag#PROPERTY_IS_OPTION}
657     *  set to it.
658     *
659     *  @return {@code true} if the property is exposed to the CLI,
660     *      {@code false} otherwise.
661     */
662    public default boolean isOnCLI() { return hasFlag( PropertyFlag.PROPERTY_IS_ARGUMENT ) || hasFlag( PropertyFlag.PROPERTY_IS_OPTION ); }
663
664    /**
665     *  <p>{@summary 'Merges' the attributes from a
666     *  {@linkplain SpecialPropertyType special property}
667     *  with the attributes retrieved from the configuration bean
668     *  specification and returns a new instance of {@code PropertySpec}.} The
669     *  original instance remains unchanged.</p>
670     *  <p>If the property is not a special property (the flag
671     *  {@link PropertyFlag#PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL}
672     *  is not set), this instance will be returned.</p>
673     *
674     *  @return The effective property specification.
675     */
676    public PropertySpec merge();
677}
678//  interface PropertySpec
679
680/*
681 *  End of File
682 */
